review_text: I’ve been drinking this tea for a long time. This latest delivery tastes different. I don’t like the taste at all. I thought I was going off tea, but having changed to a different tea, it’s still my favourite drink.

product_description: Comfort Intense Fresh Sky Fabric Conditioner 38 Wash 570ml
review_text: The hype attached to the scent of fabric conditioner is something as a family we ignore. All we want is for the clothes to smell fresh and pleasant after a wash, to be soft and comfortable to wear and for the product to be economical. Fortunately, this one fulfills all the criteria. When I say 'to smell fresh and pleasant' I don't mean stink the place out with the scent and overpower and wilt everything in a 100 yard radius. Again, fortunately, this doesn't do so and so gets a general thumbs up, but I could have done without the wording bigging up the wonderfulness of the smells. To me that's an alarm call not to purchase! I'll whisk myself away with my own favourite perfumes. I don't want my clothes having a big-smell life of their own!

product_description: Persil & Comfort New Baby Essential Laundry Kit(3 Items)
review_text: These are gentle, skin-kind versions within the Persil and Comfort ranges. The bundled pack is a practical suggestion that offers good value compared to the individual retail prices of 2x25 wash Persil and 1x38 wash Comfort, making the fabric softener effectively free. I can't remember not using Persil non-biological as my laundry detergent of choice, it's the brand I grew up with - one that doesn't irritate the eczema and allergy prone skin of several members of my family. It has a pleasant, but not overly dominant scent, and the fluid formulation means this can be used even on cold washes. The Comfort is a highly concentrated version in quite a small bottle. In real life, the bottle is rather smaller than the product photo makes it appear in relation to the Persil, but this doesn't represent poor value (38 washes worth is 38 washes worth regardless of the size container in which it comes) and the small size does a good job of keeping the use of packaging materials down.

product_description: Cornetto Made with Soy and Gluten Free Ice Cream Cones 4 x 90ml
review_text: Im a Coeliac and intolerant to cows milk, and have a huge sweet tooth. Ive found some amazing vegan ice cream alternatives. Ocado sell a number of delicious ones. I also LOVE Tescos gluten and dairy free Cornettos However was super excited to try these, especially after all the amazing reviews. The tops are covered in nuts and chocolate, and the cone is thick and crispy. However none of these bits are quite enough to hide the awful taste of the ice cream. I cant even describe it as bland, as it had a flavour.... just an awful one. It was not creamy and ice cream like. It was like frozen whipped up soya milk that they removed the flavour from. I enjoyed eating the chocolate and nut part and the cone, and just cringed my way through the ice cream part. Cant understand all the rave reviews. The vegan Magnums however are spot on and delicious!!!

product_description: Dove Nourishing Medium to Dark Visible Glow 400ml
review_text: I've always longed for more of a healthy colour to my skin as I am extremely pale, but have been put off each time I have used a tanning product because- well, it's been disastrous. However! This is the first (and only) successful product that i have used which creates a beautifully even, healthy and natural tan within a few days.I could not rate this enough. I also have sensitive, spot-prone skin on my face but I have been able to use this on my face successfully as well. Long-lasting, deeply moisturising and super natural. 10/10 my favourite!

product_description: Dove DermaSpa Fair to Medium Summer Revived 200ml
review_text: Love this! I am fair haired, blue eyed, lily white skin older lady who burns to a crisp in the sun, when i uncover. Having just returned from holiday i wanted to at least look like i had a tan but it was very cold there. I bought this on offer and went for Fair - Med. The first time i put it on my arms all over sparingly i didnt really notice that much although there was definately something. Today i thought let me add a bit more after a my usual morning shower. I applied a bit more liberally over arms legs, and face. I have had comments today on what a lovely glow i have. It has developed nicely today. I have a sassy looking healthy bod and i feel good. Bought another tube and just ordered a few more whilst on offer. I hate sitting in the sun and burning (unless i am covered in P20 lotion) and this is a very safe way to get the bronze look. No streaks, easy to apply, doesnt stain hands, slight tan smell but not too much. I am hooked.

product_description: Comfort Intense Fuchsia Passion Fabric Conditioner 38 Wash 570ml
review_text: At the current price, this works out at about 7.5p per wash, which considering the price of own label fabric conditioner is good value. Okay, you have to buy a box of it, but, if you have enough storage space, it's the way to go. It has a pleasant scent and it's a good size, though in this house we've been used to bigger bottles. The claim is it has 36 washes per bottle but that's using the recommended 1/2 cap, but I have to admit we've been using slightly more than that. Okay, that own label stuff will be cheaper and does come in a larger size but you do tend to have to use a bit more each wash.

product_description: Comfort Intense Fuchsia Passion Fabric Conditioner 38 Wash 570ml

product_description: Tresemme Heat Defence Spray 300ml
review_text: Brought this years ago and loved it then when I went to get it again couldn't find it so I'm so happy I did find it again as its perfect, works so well and you get a lovely soft feel after drying your hair rather than dry and brittle. Love it and would recommend to anyone and will be buying more now I've found it again.

product_description: Comfort Intense Fresh Sky Fabric Conditioner 38 Wash 570ml
review_text: I'm used to using the standard Comfort fabric conditioner as it's a brand I buy regularly; this concentrated version is quite impressive – with only a 15ml measure required for my modest laundry load it is economical and just as effective as the standard product. The scent is pleasant and lasting. I haven`t checked around widely for prices, but this 8 bottle pack currently works out cheaper than my local supermarket for the same product. Very happy with the results.

product_description: Sure Active Dry Antiperspirant Deodorant Aerosol 250ml
review_text: Smells nice for the 5 minutes it works for. I have been using several of these for the past week and I have BO I never had with other brands. Now I'm stuck with cans I can't use....

product_description: Persil & Comfort New Baby Essential Laundry Kit(3 Items)
review_text: I used Persil non-bio for many years, but changed to a brand specifically for babies about eight years ago, so it was a bit of a homecoming using it again. I really like the flip-top opening and how smoothly the product pours into the dispenser ball, which is much easier than the crosscut design on my usual brand that requires a fair amount of pressure. I never had a problem with how well Persil cleans, and this hasn’t changed; a machine load of baby clothes – together with stains - muslins and bedding came out spotless. With the addition of the Comfort Pure conditioner, the laundry was very soft and smelled lovely. It also performs well on general washing. I have decided to go back to using Persil non-bio; not just for the frustration-free dispenser, but it performs so well and is kind to skin. Using it again has made me wonder why I ever left the brand in the first place.

product_description: Comfort Intense Fresh Sky Fabric Conditioner 38 Wash 570ml
review_text: I was a bit worried that a product called 'Intense' might leave an overpowering scent on your laundry, who wants to walk around smelling of fabric conditioner? Thankfully it's not like that at all and the scent it leaves is fresh and quite subtle (once dry) and lingers around without being too pervasive. The Fresh Sky fragrance is appealing and not too chemical-like with a fruity/floral mix. For me, it suits household items more than clothes, things like towels and bed linen are left softened and fresh-smelling. I appreciate the small bottle size and concentrated liquid and that it has less environmental impact but I do think that the concentrated liquids are less effective at softening than the more dilute liquids are. If you're looking for the best softening then consider a full-sized bottle but if you prefer a more subtle softening effect but the same fresh fragrance then this concentrated version is a great buy.

product_description: Simple Water Boost Hydrating Booster 25ml
review_text: It the perfect and gentle product, focusing on hydration! Not tacky at all , which is also very important to me, goes with every cream :) Highly recommend !!!

review_text: I used these everyday for about 3 months and they are great I love simple wipes anyway but these ones are great they remove all your make up and leave your skin feeling refreshed I will definitely buy these [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

review_text: I bought this a couple of months ago along with the cleanser and moisturiser as i have spot prone, oily skin and occasional issues with dermatitis around my eyes. I thought I was crazy as Simple is supposed to be gentle on the skin but after using this toner it has dried my skin out and bought the dermatitis back around my eyes so they are very red, the skin flaky and sore in places. product_description: Comfort Intense Fuchsia Passion Fabric Conditioner 38 Wash 570ml
review_text: These are 540ml bottles giving 36 wash loads of Fuchsia Passion fabric conditioner by Comfort. The bottles are entirely plastic, made from 100% recycled plastic and are 100% recyclable. The bottles have a narrow screw top, which is used as the measure, and the bottle has an accurate slim pourer – no dribbles. This one is concentrated and needs only ½ a capful for each washload. I've used Comfort on and off for many years and this Fuchsia Passion fragrance is a very nice, light floral fragrance. My towels and clothing all felt nice and soft after being washed and dried, and had a lovely smell of flowers with a hint of fruit – mango? – and freshly laundered clothing. It's not too strong or overpowering at all – just a nice smell of just washed clothes.

product_description: Simple Kind To Skin+ Protecting Moisture Cream SPF30 50ml
review_text: I started using Cerave's facial lotion a few months ago and since had constant breakouts which isn't the norm for me. Wanting to love the product, I persisted until very recently when I decided enough was enough. I picked up this Simple one and it's the best thing I've done. Within two days not only have my current spots begun to clear, the overall look of my face is so much calmer. Just goes to show that all the fancy, long named, sciencey products don't always come up on top over simple and gentle products like this one.

product_description: Comfort Intense Fuchsia Passion Fabric Conditioner 38 Wash 570ml
review_text: It's great that a lot of effort has been made to reduce the plastic needed for this product and by making the softener more concentrated less of that is needed too, though I see some buyers say they're still using the same amount they're used to doing with the larger bottles. This probably explains why there is so much said on the label explaining that a little goes a long way with this product. I have the fuchsia perfume version which smells OK and isn't overpowering. This is a big plus for me as I have had difficulty with the intensely perfumed products in the past. Note that the outer plastic sleeve isn't recyclable, so this needs to be disposed of separately.

product_description: Comfort Intense Fresh Sky Fabric Conditioner 38 Wash 570ml

product_description: Comfort Intense Fuchsia Passion Fabric Conditioner 38 Wash 570ml
review_text: Clearly this latest product variation from Comfort is to address some environmental concerns and plastics waste. The product is highly concentrated, so comes in a smaller bottle that is itself recycled. Reduced packaging and transport costs. All very commendable. Just how concentrated the product is can be sensed from the fact that you can detect the scent before you even open the bottle. When you do, don't breath deeply (as I did), it's overpowering. However, in it's more dilute form (just half a cap per load), it does add a pleasant, attractively "flowery" aroma to your clothes. All scents will be a matter of taste, but we like it and our washing feels soft and pleasant (though we were already regular Comfort users). In this form the product represents good value for a quality product and for those who want to lessen their impact on the environment (albeit in the smallest of ways), there's something for you here, too.

product_description: Comfort Intense Fuchsia Passion Fabric Conditioner 38 Wash 570ml
review_text: I love this product. It retains the quality one expects from the well known makers and leaves clothes feeling soft and smelling fresh. The concept of ultra concentrate isn't new as I recall they did one years ago in a tetra type pack. But now maybe public are ready for this innovation. The container is made from recycled plastic which is fantastic and refillable. It is also recyclable but the sleeve isn't which is a disappointment. I'm hoping the refill packs are from a more cardboard style pack though and fully recyclable. I'm glad it has a dose counter as it seems so much less to use it would be easy to put in too much if it wasn't there. My other half and I have sensitive skin and this was fine for us to use. I found it hard to read the small print on the wrapper even with magnification glass. But I couldn't see anything to say if it was tested on animals or if any animal products used in the making. Although this is not a food product these are issues that are important for many. Whilst it provides details of the headquarter offices it doesn't actually say where its produced, I think this would be helpful to know as for many people myself included would prefer to buy products made in country of sale to reduce carbon footprint. I am a little torn about this product as if it was a washing powder or liquid and comfort softener combination I can't help thinking that cuts down packaging and carbon footprint further and can be better value. However separate comfort softener such as this does make clothes smell lovely.

There are 36 washes based on the half capful dose for 4-5kg loads, so as I usually do larger loads I should get approximately 18 washes per bottle. product_description: Comfort Intense Fuchsia Passion Fabric Conditioner 38 Wash 570ml

I am very impressed that Comfort have concentrated their fabric conditioner and are using recycled plastic in the bottle to cut the amount of plastics used. product_description: Persil & Comfort New Baby Essential Laundry Kit(3 Items)
review_text: Although biological detergents are generally more effective than non-bio versions this version of Persil works well enough on babies wear and on normal soiling of the clothes of older people with sensitive skin. This handy pack includes two bottles of Persil non-bio liquid detergent (24 wash size) and one of Comfort Pure fabric conditioner (36 wash size) and is decent value at eleven pounds currently from Amazon. These two non-biological products are dermatologically tested and endorsed by the British Skin Foundation – they have been developed especially to be kind to sensitive baby skin. Good cleaning power for a non-biological washing detergent with soft and safe conditioning – well worth trying on your little one's clothes, or on your own if you have sensitive skin.

product_description: Comfort Intense Fresh Sky Fabric Conditioner 38 Wash 570ml
review_text: I've not used a separate conditioner in years, because most washing products these days seem to do it all. I hadn't realised how much of a scent boost a separate fabric conditioner delivers, and how much it actually does soften the wash. The bottles - 6 of them, and not 8 as the ad states, come in a compact box and tbh, that itself could be used to deliver the products in, rather than having that placed in an Amazon box with more paper wrapping. All of the packaging, including the empty bottles, can be recycled. You don't waste any of the liquid, as the top of the bottle is well designed to minimise spillage and so that you can pour just what you need (half a capful is recommended, but I went with a little more), and not a gush of liquid from a large spout. I've had to dry indoors today due to the weather, and my whole house smells of this. I'm really impressed with this, and even for 6 bottles rather than the stated 8, this is good value for money. I also like that the small bottles mean that I can store them on a lower shelf for heavier items, rather than risking my under-sink shelving collapsing (yes, it's happened more than once!). Just don't squeeze the bottles hard, as they're made from recycled plastic and are a little flimsy-feeling.

product_description: Magnum  Double Raspberry Ice Cream 3 x 88ml
review_text: If I was a wild-eyed enthusiast and was asked to rate free Magnums as part of a promotion I'd perhaps err on the generous side. As a paying customer, however, these are nothing to write home about. There's an uncomfortable flavour clash, between the dark chocolate coating and the sickly sweet raspberry sauce which covers the core, that's difficult to describe. The core itself reminded me of the cheapest imaginable insipid, own brand raspberry ice-cream with little of the smooth creaminess you find in other Magnums. It's almost as if they rushed the product development process and ended up with bitter raspberry ripple on a stick. So, so disappointing when you consider what these could have been.

product_description: Persil & Comfort New Baby Essential Laundry Kit(3 Items)
review_text: We use Persin non-bio washing liquid all the time. It is by far the best washing liquid for sensitive skin. I suffer from eczema and have tried all sorts of sensitive skin washing liquids / powder but Persil is without a doubt the best. Comfort adds a little bit of softens to the whole mix and makes the clothes softer thus easier to wear / removing the little bit of stiffness that can irritate very sensitive skin.

product_description: Persil & Comfort New Baby Essential Laundry Kit(3 Items)
review_text: I have used this brand forever and love the way it never upsets any skin, especially when washing sheets and items that are next to the body such as jeans, underwear. Ever since I had small babies and now helping with grandchildren, this is the most child-friendly of all the branded washing products. Recommended by the Skin Foundation means you can try any eczema-afflicted skin with this item with confidence. Having the smaller, ultra concentrated Pure Comfort as an extra means you can dish up an extra helping of softness when required. Just a little amount will do the job. Altogether 48 washes from the two handy bottles of Persil's Non-Bio liquid detergent can be carefully measured into the bubble pod, so no waste. In our soft water area, the lesser amount can be used. Yes, it still sorts out everyday stains, no worries there. The scent is fresh and clean, the whole house smells lovely when the laundry is on the go, being aired and ironed.

product_description: Comfort Intense Fuchsia Passion Fabric Conditioner 38 Wash 570ml
review_text: Although the bottle is only 540 ml, the conditioner is very concentrated, so you only use half a capfull at a time - this means you get over 35 washes per bottle. The bottle is made of recycled plastic, and it is in turn recyclable (though not the sleeve), which is a bonus. The fuchsia smell is very pleasant, and clothes end up nice and soft. product_description: Comfort Ultra Concentrated Pure Fabric Conditioner 38 Wash 570ml

product_description: Persil & Comfort New Baby Essential Laundry Kit(3 Items)
review_text: In this "kit" for sensitive skin you get x2 Persil non-biological washing detergent (potentially 48 washes) and x1 ultra-concentrate Comfort Pure (potentially 38 washes). I say potentially because if you are doing larger loads you'll need to increase the amount you use. We tend to alternate between Fairy and Persil non-bio, not only because we have young children but also because some family members have sensitive skin. We've never had an issue with someone having a reaction due to Persil, it's probably our preferred brand. We don't use Comfort Pure all the time because some members of the family don't like how it leaves their clothes feeling (too soft!), but we do use it on the children's clothes because it leaves them nice and soft. Both products in this kit are endorsed by the British Skin Foundation. Price for the kit at the time of writing the review is £11, this is slightly more than you would currently get the individual products in some supermarkets (£3 for each product). But you are getting them delivered too. If you wanted to give a practical baby shower gift, this would be ideal, slightly different to a nappy pyramid. Would also make a practical house-warming present. Overall - good products that work, slightly on the expensive side.

product_description: Comfort Intense Fresh Sky Fabric Conditioner 38 Wash 570ml
review_text: Clearly this latest product variation from Comfort is to address some environmental concerns and plastics waste. The product is highly concentrated, so comes in a smaller bottle that is itself recycled. Reduced packaging and transport costs. All very commendable. Just how concentrated the product is can be sensed from the fact that you can detect the scent before you even open the bottle. When you do, don't breath deeply (as I did), it's overpowering. However, in it's more dilute form (just half a cap per load), it does add a pleasant, slightly zesty aroma to your clothes. The scent will be a matter of taste, but we like it and our washing feels soft and pleasant (though we were already regular Comfort users). In this form the product represents good value for a quality product and for those who want to lessen their impact on the environment (albeit in the smallest of ways), there's something for you here, too.

product_description: Comfort Intense Fuchsia Passion Fabric Conditioner 38 Wash 570ml

review_text: Superb kit. The persil non-bio is great and we use it for all our clothes and other than really stubborn stains its great. One word of warning. product_description: Bovril  Extract Beef and Yeast 250g
review_text: Perfect taste, not so salty flavour as other yeast based products. Buying again today. To be honest love it on toast!

product_description: Comfort Intense Fresh Sky Fabric Conditioner 38 Wash 570ml
review_text: Our household normally use comfort, however I hadn't used the 'Fresh Sky' scent before, which I must say is really nice! Just don't go sniffing directly from the bottle as it's concentrated, the scent is much more intense that it really is. The ultra concentrated allows for a much smaller bottle and you don't need to use as much in the washing machine either (just half a lid worth); the smaller bottle of course makes the carbon footprint smaller; in addition, the bottle is made from 100% recycled plastic which is a bonus, and both the bottle and lid can be recycled back. Only downside is the sleeve isn't, so do make sure you remove this before throwing the bottle in the recycling; hopefully they will work on making the whole thing recyclable in the future. All in all, good value for money and great scent (though the latter is subjective).

product_description: Persil & Comfort New Baby Essential Laundry Kit(3 Items)
review_text: My wife has extremely sensitive skin, which I never believed until I inadvertently washed some of her clothing in a different detergent. On that basis, she has used either Persil or Fairy products for our joint laundry for many years. Combine that with the fact that we cannot use biological products as we have a septic tank, this product is ideal. The detergent is dispensed into a capsule which is inserted into the main body of the product and then placed on top of the laundry. There is sufficient detergent for 48 washes from the two bottles. The detergent is complimented by a fabric conditioner, which is measured out into the fabric compartment softener on the washing machine; there is sufficient to condition 24 washes. Both products have a pleasant "clean" fragrance and leave clothing smelling fresh and soft after drying. A really good product for those with sensitive skin and competitively priced against normal supermarket prices.

product_description: Surf Tropical Lily Washing Liquid 85 Wash 3L
review_text: I got this only for £8.50 hope it will reduce again. As it smell is very mice and every load to the consistency of how it will continues to work.

product_description: Comfort Intense Fuchsia Passion Fabric Conditioner 38 Wash 570ml
review_text: This listing is for a pack of 8, concentrated fabric softeners, although I received a sample for review purposes. Note that the container is made from 100% recycled plastic and is suitable for further recycling, but you do need to remove the plastic wrap that holds the product information (once the bottle is used up, as you need it beforehand for dosing information). I found I needed to use a jar opener to remove the lid for the first time; I guess that is good when you are receiving this via the post as it means there is less chance of the lid coming loose and spilling contents into the parcel rather than onto your clothes. I like the scent, which transfers well to laundry and leaves it smelling floral without being overly sweet. It would be worth sniffing in a shop before committing to a large pack however, as not all laundry scents are to everyone’s taste. The softness is fantastic, particularly noticeable after laundry has been dried outside, which normally makes it feel stiff. A bottle will cover up to 36 loads (4-5 Kg), you will only manage 16 larger, 6-7 Kg loads. The bottle looks small, but the liquid is very concentrated, so do use the dosing cap rather than just pour into the machine as you will otherwise use too much (probably).

product_description: Comfort Intense Fuchsia Passion Fabric Conditioner 38 Wash 570ml
review_text: This is a lovely scent of fresh flowers (Fushia) and it really does make a good job of fragrancing up the clothes in the wash. The bottle is small as the liquid is a condensed type and this bottle is capable of 36 washes (apparently), however, I would say that to get a really fragrance you do have to use a little more than it says on the bottle....however, that may be down to my taste to be honest as I do like my laundry to be very fragrant. You put the liquid in the soap/conditioner drawer and measure a small amount out in the lid.

product_description: Pot Noodle  Chicken & Mushroom Standard 90g

product_description: Comfort Intense Fresh Sky Fabric Conditioner 38 Wash 570ml
review_text: Great fragrance that strikes just the right balance - although the wife complains that the small bottles are very difficult to pour accurately from. They probably are if you slurp in what you reckon is a full measure and, in fact, it is nearer two full measures. This is a really quick way to use up a small 540 ml bottle….but….if you use the cap as a measure as it is supposed to be…..then you will find it is a very economical way to use the conditioner! Very cool fragrance which actually carries through to your clothes, making you smell like a Fresh Sky – if you know what such a thing smells like? Something else I really like about this conditioner is that the bottles are all made from recyclable plastic and the manufacturer is asking for customers to recycle the new bottles so they can go the same path third time around! Three Stars for the product and another one for being good and green.

product_description: Dove Nourishing Medium to Dark Visible Glow 400ml
review_text: After being caught out by the sudden nice weather and me still being as pale as an uncooked chip I bought a bottle of this to try. It is a really natural even colour. There is a bit of a whiff of fake tan when you first apply it but it wears off after a few hours. My skins feels so smooth and moisturised too which is an added bonus!

product_description: Persil Powercaps Non Bio Washing Capsules 38 Wash, 1026g
review_text: Some things in life are enjoyable to buy and some things plainly are not. No matter how pretty the product and how bright and bold the actual washing detergent is, it will always be a grudge purchase. No one likes to have dirty smelly clothes and wash powder / tablets / capsules are a necessity that makes a hole in everyone's weekly grocery budget that could be better spent on something interesting such as cakes or exotic vegetables that you have to look up how to cook. Along with Ariel, Fairy and Bold, Persil is one of the big brands that dominant the market for detergents. It is owned by global consumer products giant Unilever who are experts at branding and marketing. It is refreshing to see these capsules at such reasonable value., they work out 15p each which is an absolute bargain. Even the dodgy imitation ones you find in sub prime supermarkets are more than these, and the great thing about Persil is that you can guarantee that the product is going to be high quality. These capsules come in a rubbery gossamer coated casing containing a different brightly coloured gel like liquids in each of the four compartments. And very funky they look too with purple, green, white and grey swirls of gu. These things wash your clothes nicely too and have a pleasant smell without being too overbearing. I have no idea what happens to the plasticated casing on the outside of the capsule after you put in in the washing machine. Maybe it bio-de-grades, maybe it disappears by magic, this is one of lives great mysteries like the Great Sphinx at Giza, the Bermuda Triangle or the meaning of the Voynich Manuscript.
